contradictions.description: At-risk mental health but poor foundational self-care (sleep/exercise/diet). Interventions less effective without basics.
contradictions.explanation: Therapy and medication work better with sleep/exercise/nutrition foundation. Can't out-therapy a terrible lifestyle.
contradictions.recommendation: While seeking professional help, prioritize: (1) 7-8h sleep, (2) 30min daily movement, (3) regular meals. These amplify treatment.

recommendations.advice: Implement strict work boundaries: use Pomodoro technique (25min focus + 5min break), set hard stop time at 6pm, disable work notifications after hours
recommendations.rationale: Knowledge work requires sustained cognitive focus. Without breaks, mental fatigue compounds stress and reduces code quality/decision-making.
recommendations.job_specific: Schedule 'deep work' blocks in morning when cognitive capacity is highest. Use afternoon for meetings and lighter tasks.

recommendations.advice: Improve sleep hygiene: stop coding 1h before bed, dim lights after 9pm, keep bedroom cool (65-68°F), maintain consistent sleep schedule (even weekends)
recommendations.rationale: Sleep deprivation amplifies anxiety and impairs logical reasoning. Tech workers often have delayed circadian rhythms from late-night coding.
recommendations.job_specific: No debugging in bed. Use f.lux/Night Shift on all devices. If mind races about code, keep 'brain dump' notepad by bed.

recommendations.advice: Reduce caffeine dependence: cut off coffee after 2pm, switch afternoon coffee to green tea (lower caffeine), drink water between coffees, aim for <300mg/day
recommendations.rationale: Excessive caffeine creates dependence cycle, disrupts sleep, and increases jitteriness during high-pressure debugging or presentations.
recommendations.job_specific: Don't use caffeine to mask poor sleep. Front-load caffeine in morning. Consider L-theanine supplement with coffee for smoother focus.

recommendations.advice: Schedule your next mental health check-in 2-4 weeks from now to establish trend data. Consistent tracking reveals patterns that single assessments miss.
recommendations.rationale: Mental health fluctuates. Tracking trends helps differentiate temporary stress from chronic issues, and validates that interventions are working.

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Workload reduction intervention (35 cases) - participants who reduced from 10h to 8-9h showed 27% lower perceived stress
specific_actions: Set hard stop time: leave 2.0h earlier, block it as 'meeting' in calendar
Use Pomodoro technique: 25min focused work + 5min break (prevents overtime creep)
Negotiate priorities with manager: 'I want great work, need to focus on top 3 items'

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Therapy intervention participants showed stress reduction in 4-6 sessions. Meditation programs (48 completers) reduced stress over 2-4 weeks
specific_actions: Start 10-min daily meditation (Headspace, Calm, Insight Timer) - reduces cortisol by 23% in 8 weeks
Box breathing during stress spikes: 4s inhale → 4s hold → 4s exhale → 4s hold (5 rounds)
Consider EAP (Employee Assistance Program) or therapist - stress management is a learned skill

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Users who increased sleep from <7h to 7-8h saw 31% reduction in stress scores within 2 weeks
specific_actions: Set a bedtime alarm for 1.5h earlier than usual
Create a wind-down routine: dim lights 1h before bed, no screens 30min before
Keep consistent sleep schedule (even weekends) - irregular sleep disrupts circadian rhythm

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Meditation intervention participants improved sleep quality by average 2.3 points over 6-8 weeks
specific_actions: Try 4-7-8 breathing before bed: inhale 4s, hold 7s, exhale 8s (repeat 4x)
No caffeine after 2pm (6-hour half-life fragments REM sleep)
Keep bedroom cool (65-68°F) and dark - temperature drop signals sleep onset

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: High caffeine users (>400mg) who reduced to 300mg reported improved sleep quality and reduced jitteriness
specific_actions: Cut off coffee after 2pm (6-hour half-life disrupts sleep architecture)
Switch afternoon coffee to green tea (lower caffeine, L-theanine smooths energy)
Don't use caffeine to mask poor sleep - fixes symptom not cause

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Individuals with 4+ daily social interactions had 19% lower depression scores vs isolated group
specific_actions: Quality over quantity: one 15-min meaningful conversation > 10 shallow chats
Schedule weekly social: friend dinner, hobby group, or team lunch (prevents isolation drift)
Remote work: video calls for collaboration (not just slack) - face time builds connection

insights: This is your first assessment. Future assessments will track trends.
